name: Aphyon - The Drow Guard Dog (Monk / Rogue / ... )
author: Bonnie-The-Lady

posts.author: Bonnie-The-Lady
posts.content:
Hello,

new here, first post. I already looked around here a while, also tried out some builds but also love to create some interesting RP characters.
Now I am acutally sitting on a new project, handling with a Class I haven't tried much before (the Monk class). I am actually having some trouble here which I don't understand fully. That's why I am posting this actually unfinished build. I hope you can help me and also give me some feedback on my progress.
Okay, let me introduce you

Aphyon - The Drow Guard Dog

The Concept of this Build should be:
Aphyon is a male drow and the „guard dog“/general dogsbody of a Drow House. He will do his tasks, but he has no pleasure in them and wants to finish them as quickly as possible. He is mainly on duty to guard the Drow-House, spot any danger early and eliminate them as quickly as possible. In case of fighting he prefers just to approach the enemy and kill them as fast as possible, not allowing the enemy to do too much of actions. Sometimes he is also being sent out to do tasks like finding lost members, spy on activities or open some locked doors or chests to attain more information or a new way.

In this RP-requirement there are already a handful of demands:
He has to be fast and flexible and should have as many attacks per round as possible (that's why IMHO monk is preferable). He should be good in spot, listen, search and detecting and disabling traps. He doesn't „tank“ out attacks, so high HPs are not important. He prefers more not to be hit. So AC is not bad, but feats like self concealment and Epic Dodge are more preferable. High tumble would be good in this case. As good spotter and going in advance sometimes to detect the danger or guard, he should be good in hiding and sneaking. Open doors are also an RP requirement. Rogue would fit in here good.
In RP case a blade fighting Drow fits better than just a „fist using one“.

PvM or PvP – Main Focus to PvM, but stable PvP would be also important for RP sake
Level cap – 40
Race: (Elf) Drow
Concept: Rogue / Monk / (Fighter?) (also wondering about other options than fighter, e.g. SD for Hide in Plain Sight)
Weapon Preference: A blade like Kukri. A Kama just made me feeling uncomfortable with the RP setting. Rapier is/should be already too heavy; Dagger/Short Sword another option?
Maximum item enhancement – I think it's classified as “Medium Magic Environment”, you can gain many enhancements, but mostly capped at approx. +5
Spellcasting: No Spellcasting. Enough Magic Devices Available, so UMD is useful. As guard dog a “tinker with things” makes sense.

Why does he suck in Kukri fighting? I even tried to give him bonuses in this, (Weapon Specialization etc.). I am sure I missed a rule about Monks with weapons. Maybe someone can give me a hint and help so I can rethink about this draft?

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hi there Bonnie - welcome aboard!

Just a couple of quick things. The Monk attacks per round (APR) schedule is only achievable with either kamas or unarmed, otherwise it's back to standard progression. So, while I understand your rp reasoning, kukris will never get as many APR as kamas (and, of course, you'll get the normal -5AB per attack, rather than kamas' -3).

Also, I don't know whether in your looking round here you've encountered this build, but I can highly recommend Mick Dagger's Kama-Shinobi (Monk 9/ Assassin 26/ Shadow Dancer 5). You can find it on the first page of the Full Epic sub-forum. It's definitely worth looking at.

Cheers

- Why did you push up Charisma to 10? 
- UMD is pushed up to 35. Someone in this forum said once (I think it was HipRedux, but cannot find the post again unfortunately) UMD over 33 is just kind too many points "wasted". So maybe reduce UMD e.g. to 33 and also disable traps is extremly high. IMHO most traps are either mid-balanced or un-disable in most modules. So if we could take a few skill points out from these, maybe shift back to Dex instead of that high int?

I am actually rebuilding your version, Empyre65 and testing it and wondering about those tweaking points mentioned.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
CHA 10 is for the UMD skill to not have a penalty.

I set UMD to 35 because I have that multiple-of-5 thing ingrained into my psyche. UMD 33 is enough to use all scrolls without failure, so if you are playing in a medium-to-low magic environment, that is enough. I play in high-magic environments a lot. For example, in Sands of Fate that I just finished, I had +12 Monk boots that required more than 40 UMD. Every time I loaded a saved game, the boots would get unequipped because my UMD was not high enough until boosted by my other gear to 50. I was always able to re-equip it, but I had to remember to do it.

I learned the hard way that even the OC has custom traps with higher than standard DCs. With 48 Disarm (need +2 from gear), you can not only disarm standard epic traps but also recover them. Also, the higher your Set Trap, the higher the DCs of your traps. so traps set by other players will have higher-than-standard DCs, so you need all the Search and Disarm you can get.

To disarm standard epic traps, you need a net Disarm skill of 38, and to find them in the first round that you are in range, you need a net Search skill of 42.

If you lower your INT, you will have to choose an entire skill to drop completely.
